intro: Andromeda ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty andromeda, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in moist, acidic soils of forested areas. The plant features evergreen foliage with dark green leaves that have a leathery texture. Its showy, bell-shaped flowers are typically pink or red, blooming in late spring to early summer. Andromeda ferruginea is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in shaded environments.
